alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Lake; Obion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 9:25AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following counties, Dyer, Lake and Obion. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 925 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dyersburg, Newbern, Ridgely, Cloverdale, Miston, Bradleytown, Cottonwood Grove, Trimble, Millsfield, Lane, Bogota, Cat Corner, Maxey, Nauvoo, Broadmoor, Minnick, Gratio, Elbridge, Jenkinsville and Sharps Ferry. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
